Package com.karandev.io.util.console

Class CommandLineArgs

java.lang.Object
com.karandev.io.util.console.CommandLineArgs
public final class CommandLineArgs extends Object
Utility class for validating command line argument counts.

Provides static methods to check if the number of command line arguments matches specific conditions (equals, not equals, greater, less, etc.). If a check fails, an error message is printed and the application exits with the specified exit code.

Copyleft (c) 1993 by C and System Programmers Association (CSD) All Rights Free

Author:
CSD Development Group

  • Method Details

    • checkLengthEquals

      public static void checkLengthEquals(int argsLen, int len, String message)
      Checks if the number of arguments equals the expected length. Exits with code 1 if the check fails.
      Parameters:
      argsLen - actual number of arguments
      len - expected number of arguments
      message - error message to display if check fails

    • checkLengthEquals

      public static void checkLengthEquals(int argsLen, int len, String message, int exitCode)
      Checks if the number of arguments equals the expected length. Exits with the specified exit code if the check fails.
      Parameters:
      argsLen - actual number of arguments
      len - expected number of arguments
      message - error message to display if check fails
      exitCode - exit code to use if check fails

    • checkLengthNotEquals

      Checks if the number of arguments does not equal the expected length. Exits with code 1 if the check fails.
      Parameters:
      argsLen - actual number of arguments
      len - length to compare against
      message - error message to display if check fails
